snippet: The Assad government has made gains, and the momentum has tipped, however slightly, in its direction even while the nation remains badly fractured.
abstract: Momentum in Syrian civil war tips in favor of government as rebels are ousted from several Damascus suburbs, but country remains badly fractured.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, Karam Shoumali from Istanbul, and an employee of The New York Times from Syria.

lead_paragraph: The Assad government has made gains, and the momentum has tipped, however slightly, in its direction even while the nation remains badly fractured.

headline.main: Syrian Government’s Forces Gain, but a Siege War Goes On
headline.print_headline: Syrian Government’s Forces Gain, but a Siege War Goes On

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
